Description: Microsoft Azure AI Platform is a cloud-based suite of AI services within Azure for building, training, deploying, and managing AI applications. It includes Azure Machine Learning, Cognitive Services, Azure OpenAI Service, and Azure Bot Service, supporting end-to-end workflows from data preparation to monitoring. The platform integrates with enterprise-grade security, compliance, and scalability features, and connects with tools like Azure Databricks, Synapse, and Kubernetes. It supports both prebuilt APIs and custom model development, enabling use cases across NLP, computer vision, speech, search, and generative AI.

Description: Vertex AI Platform is a unified machine learning platform on Google Cloud that supports the end-to-end ML lifecycle, including training, deployment, and management of models and applications. It offers AutoML for no-code model creation, custom model training with popular frameworks, and pre-trained APIs for vision and language tasks. The platform includes MLOps capabilities such as pipelines, experiment tracking, feature store, deployment, and monitoring. It also provides access to a catalog of generative AI models that can be customized and deployed.
Languages: Python, Java, Node.js, Go, C#, Ruby
Mapping: Vertex AI, Google Vertex AI, Vertex AI Platform
Related Tools: Data warehouse, AutoML, Deep learning frameworks, Logging, Workflow automation, Edge AI, Monitoring

Description: Google Cloud Platform (GCP) is a cloud computing suite by Google providing IaaS, PaaS, and serverless services for building, deploying, and scaling applications on Google’s global infrastructure. It offers compute, storage, databases, networking, analytics, and AI/ML services with features like Kubernetes Engine, Compute Engine, App Engine, Cloud Functions, and Cloud Run. Developers use integrated tools such as Cloud Build, Cloud Code, and observability services, with support for CI/CD, security via IAM, and global load balancing. GCP provides pay-as-you-go pricing, a free tier, and $300 in credits for new users.

Description: DataRobot Enterprise AI Platform is an enterprise solution for automating the development, deployment, and management of machine learning models. It provides capabilities such as algorithm recommendation, automated feature engineering, model evaluation and explainability, and end-to-end AI lifecycle management. The platform leverages popular ML libraries including scikit-learn, H2O, and TensorFlow, and supports scalable, collaborative workflows. It integrates with major enterprise ecosystems and data platforms to operationalize AI across cloud, hybrid, and on‑prem environments.

Description: Google AI Studio is a browser-based developer platform for building, testing, and deploying generative AI applications using Google’s Gemini family and other supported models. It provides a unified playground for text, image, video, and audio generation, along with features like advanced prompt controls, structured outputs, function calling, and a native code editor. Developers can prototype in the UI and integrate via the Gemini API and Google GenAI SDK, with options for single-click deployment to Cloud Run and real-time usage monitoring. The platform includes security and privacy features and supports model tuning and agentic workflows.
Parent: Gemini API, Google GenAI SDK, Google Cloud Run
Mapping: Google AI Studio, AI Studio, Gemini AI Studio
Category: Generative AI, Prototyping, Model deployment, Prompting, Multimodal
